lcInstruction.p: In the previous lesson, you learned about different DITA publishing environments. The rest of this course covers publishing through a standalone DITA Open Toolkit.
The following instructions show you how to install the DITA Open Toolkit on your machine.

p.xref: Video: Installing the DITA Open Toolkit

step.cmd: In a web browser, go to the SourceForge website (), where the open-source DITA OT is available.

info.p: The latest DITA OT distribution package will be displayed at the top of the page. The page also contains a link to the latest version that is under development for testing, followed by a list of previous versions of the DITA OT.

note.p: At the time of this course's release, the latest version of the DITA OT was 2.4.4.

step.cmd: Click on the button to download the latest distribution package of the DITA OT.

info.p: The DITA OT will be downloaded as a zip folder.

step.cmd: Locate the DITA OT zip folder in your system folder structure to ensure that the download completed successfully.
Choose a folder on your machine where you want to install the DITA Open Toolkit.

note.p: The commands used to publish output through the DITA OT don't do well with spaces or special characters in file and path names. Therefore, it's best to install the OT at the root level of your machine's system folder structure in a folder that only uses letters, numbers, underscores, or hyphens in its name.

step.cmd: Move the DITA OT zip folder you downloaded into the new folder you chose in the previous step.

info.p: On a PC: Right-click the zip folder and click "Extract" to unzip the contents into the new location. Also mention something here about uzing a zip utility tool such as 7Zip?
On a Mac: Double-click the zip folder. This will automatically unzip its contents into the new location.
